info.title: Accounting
info.description:
DATEVconnect supports the integration of DATEV solutions within the on-premise environment.
This enables bidirectional data interchange between DATEV programs and solutions from other software manufacturers. 

This documentation describes REST resources and provides relevant information.
info.x-datev-shortdescription: Allows a simple bidirectional data transfer between third party solutions and DATEV-Rechnungswesen applications.

AccountingSumsAndBalancesId.name: accounting-sums-and-balances-id
AccountingSumsAndBalancesId.description: ID of an account from the accounting sums and balances list

AssetId.name: asset-id
AssetId.description: ID consisting of the area and the asset-id

GeneralLedgerAccountId.name: general-ledger-account-id
GeneralLedgerAccountId.description: ID of the general ledger account

Select.name: select
Select.description:
Comma separated list of properties to which the results will then be limited.
Example: select=id

Top.name: top
Top.description:
States the maximum number of elements that should be contained within the total.
Example: top=10

Skip.name: skip
Skip.description:
States how many elements in the total number of items should be skipped.
Example: skip=10

Filter.name: filter
Filter.description:
Entering a filter expression influences the number of results.
Example: filter=is_abc eq true and xy_number eq 10000
Filter.x-example: filter=is_abc eq true and xy_number eq 10000

Expand.name: expand
Expand.description:
Parameter that allows reading a resource with subordinate objects. 
When specifying **"all"**, all subordinate objects are loaded (no indication corresponds to **"none"**).
Example: expand=all

ReferenceDate.name: reference-date
ReferenceDate.description:
Request up to a cut-off date.      
Example: reference date= 2015-04-15

StartAt.name: start-at
StartAt.description: Starting point for the search for the next available account number.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of clients/companies
get.description:
Retrieving all clients/companies within the scope of Rechnungswesen (accounting).
The clients/companies are managed over several years and are shown in the form of a list. **Retrieving clients with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of client objects will be requested.
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the client object will be requested without subordinate objects (company data).

**Additional functionality by header** When using multiple data pathes, the use of following header is recommended: - **accept: multipart/mixed, application/json**
When one or more data paths are not adapted for the current version, besides the user data an additional message will be added in the response.
Example:
```json [ { "name":"Musterholz GmbH", "number":55003, "id":"53dbd677-c477-4a4d-bde0-a6db187abb5e" }, { "name":"Testholz GmbH", "number":55004, "id":"3c15fa1e-003d-4131-9518-0cd58b104d34" } ] ```
```json [ { "error":"REW11041", "error_description":"Die angeforderten Daten konnten nicht (vollständig) geliefert werden, da nicht alle Datenpfade auf dem aktuellen Versionsstand sind. Starten Sie die Datenanpassung im Installations-Manager. Detaillierte Informationen hierzu finden Sie in Dokument 'https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9215997'.", "request_id":"80a2f2ae-dd39-456d-a355-cd6c656194f5", "additional_messages": }, { "id":"REW11041", "description":"Die angeforderten Daten konnten nicht (vollständig) geliefert werden, da nicht alle Datenpfade auf dem aktuellen Versionsstand sind. Starten Sie die Datenanpassung im Installations-Manager. Detaillierte Informationen hierzu finden Sie in Dokument 'https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9215997'.", "severity":"Information" } ] ```

200.description: Clients retrieved successfully within the scope of Rechnungswesen (accounting).

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of fiscal years
get.description:
Access the accounting fiscal years including the accounting master data of a client/company. The accounting fiscal years will be shown in the form of a list.

**Filter** It is currently not possible to filter by the property "taxation_method".

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

200.description: All available fiscal years retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve an accounts receivable list (uncondensed)
get.description:
Below, the term "Open Items" in upper case will be used as the umbrella term for all entries in accounts payable and receivable. When referring to the concrete status of "Open Items", the term will appear in lower case (e.g. "open items" or "cleared items"). Retrieve **all open and cleared uncondensed** items. Receivables comprise all Open Items entered in accounts receivable.

**Streaming** This resource supports streaming.
The number of items may differ from the unstreamed request, as the functional context is missing here.
Limitations to normal requests:
  • Properties "open_balance_of_item" and "debit_credit_identifier" are not available
  • Filter on "open_balance_of_item" cannot be applied
  • Use of paging is not supported
  • Error messages will not be displayed for the time being
**Retrieving Open Items with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of an Open Item object will be requested.
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the Open Item object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Filter** If no further parameters are entered, the list contains both open and cleared items.

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - document_field1 - date - due_date - open_balance_of_item - is_cleared **Operators** *Filter option: account_number, date, due_date, open_balance_of_item* | Operator | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | *Filter option: document_field1, is_cleared* | Operator | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | **Filter combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of Open Items that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of Open Items that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 | Please note that the functional connection of the Open Items remains intact.
In some cases, more items may be returned than were filtered by top & skip, since these items belong together.
Paging enables combinations with the filters "account_number" and "is_cleared".

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all outstanding accounts receivable:**
.../accounts-receivable?filter=is_cleared eq false **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable for the debitor with the account number 20000:**
.../accounts-receivable?filter=account_number eq 200000000 **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable for debitors with account numbers ranging from 20000 to 29999:**
.../accounts-receivable?filter=account_number ge 200000000 and account_number le 299999999 **Retrieving an uncondensed list of all accounts receivable cleared:**
.../accounts-receivable?filter=is_cleared eq true **Retrieving of the first 10 accounts receivable:**
.../accounts-receivable?top=10 **Retrieving of the next 10 accounts receivable:**
.../accounts-receivable?top=10&skip=10

200.description: Accounts receivable retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is  either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve a specific account receivable (uncondensed)
get.description:
Below, the term "Open Items" in upper case will be used as the umbrella term for all entries in accounts payable and receivable. When referring to the concrete status of "Open Items", the term will appear in lower case (e.g. "open items" or "cleared items"). Targeted access to an individual account receivable using a technical ID. Receivables comprise all Open Items entered in accounts receivable. This access request can be used to determine the current status of a specific account receivable from a previously requested list of uncondensed accounts receivable. This access request cannot be used for condensed accounts receivable.

**Retrieving Open Items with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of an Open Item object will be requested.
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the Open Item object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving an account receivable:**
.../accounts-receivable/20140101_4711

200.description: A specific account receivable retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve an accounts receivable list (condensed)
get.description:
Below, the term "Open Items" in upper case will be used as the umbrella term for all entries in accounts payable and receivable. When referring to the concrete status of "Open Items", the term will appear in lower case (e.g. "open items" or "cleared items"). Retrieve **all outstanding and cleared** receivables. Receivables comprise all Open Items entered in accounts receivable. Receivables that can be condensed will be shown in condensed form. Therefore, the results list may contain both condensed and uncondensed receivables.

The number of items may differ from the unstreamed request, as the functional context is missing here.
Limitations to normal requests:

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - document_field1 - date - due_date - open_balance_of_item - is_cleared **Operators** *Filter option: account_number, date, due_date, open_balance_of_item* | Operator | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | *Filter option: document_field1, is_cleared* | Operator | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | **Filter combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving a condensed list of all outstanding accounts receivable:**
.../accounts-receivable/condense?filter=is_cleared eq false **Retrieving a condensed list of all accounts receivable for the debitor with the account number (account_number) 20000:**
.../accounts-receivable/condense?filter=account_number eq 200000000 **Retrieving a condensed list of all accounts receivable for debitors with account numbers ranging from 20000 to 29999:**
.../accounts-receivable/condense?filter=account_number ge 200000000 and account_number le 299999999

200.description: Condensed receivables retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

get.summary: Retrieve an account postings list
get.description:
Retrieve an account postings list for general ledger/subledger accounts for a fiscal year. Postings with error flags or postings that are flagged as posting proposals are not transferred.

Note: Fee required feature. The reauired license can be ordered in the DATEV shop.

**Streaming** This resource supports streaming.
The use of streaming is recommended as there can be large amounts of data.
Limitations to normal requests:
  • Error messages will not be displayed for the time being
**Retrieving account postings with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of account postings with any existing additional information, advance payment and open item information will be requested.
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the account postings object will be requested without subordinate objects.

**Filter** If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - date - accounting_reason **Operators** *Filter option: account_number, date* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | *Filter option: accounting_reason* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | **Filter combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving all account postings:**
.../account-postings **Retrieving all account postings with the account number 20000:**
.../account-postings?filter=account_number eq 200000000 **Retrieving all account postings with account numbers ranging from 20000 to 29999:**
.../account-postings?filter=account_number ge 200000000 and account_number le 299999999

200.description: Account postings retrieved successfully.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

post.description:
Transferring an accounting sequence containing accounting records to Rechnungswesen (accounting). The accounting records transferred will be made available for processing in the "Stapelverarbeitung" of Rechnungswesen.
Exception: Accounting sequences with the record type annual financial statements are not visible in the product Mittelstand Faktura.
Using this approach, it is possible to process sequences on an individual basis or attach them to an existing (but not yet comitted) sequence. For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**Accounting period** Allocation to an accounting period is performed using "date_from" and "date_to" in the **accounting-sequence** class. It is important to ensure that both dates for the accounting sequence are within a single accounting period.

**Volume limit for accounting sequences** The maximum number of transaction records that can be written per accounting sequence depends on the infrastructure used by the client (e.g. hardware, network, etc.).

**GoBD finalization of accounting sequences** The **accounting-sequence** class features an "is_committed" property to enable accounting sequences to be transmitted with TRUE or FALSE values that indicate finalization status. This flag applies with respect to the entire accounting sequence. With delivery of Rechnungswesen version 8.0x (2019): If no finalization flag is transferred, the accounting sequence will be automatically committed after following an import into the DATEV accounting programs. For more information, please refer to the Info Database, documents [1080636](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080636) and [1080697](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080697).

**Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the accounting sequence (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2016-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences. For example: JSON = 2016-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2016) | database = 2016-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2016)

See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

200.description: An accounting sequence has been created for processing in Rechnungswesen with notifications or error messages.

204.description: An accounting sequence has been created for processing in Rechnungswesen.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of accounting sequences
get.description:

**Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. post.summary: Transfer a list of incoming invoice data
post.description:
Transferring of incoming invoice data to Rechnungswesen (accounting) which is processed to posting proposals.
When posting proposals are generated, the system fills the fields of the posting record using the debitor/creditor master data, the open item balance, the default settings in the program, and the entries in the posting proposal rules. **Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the incoming invoice data should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2016-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences. For example: JSON = 2016-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2016) | database = 2016-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2016)

See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx

get.summary: Retrieve a list of accounting sums and balances
get.description:
The list of accounting sums and balances is one of the basic evaluations of accounting and contains the list of the posted accounts.
The overview shows the development of values per account for the current fiscal year. The opening balance values, the monthly values (without opening balance), the cumulated monthly values and the total balance are displayed.

This evaluation contains current postings and closing entries.

**Filter** Ohne weitere Angabe von Parametern enthält die Liste den vollen Umfang.

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number **Operators** *Filter option: account_number* | Operators | Beschreibung | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | **Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The accounting sums and balances will be sorted by account number. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of accounts from the accounting sums and balances list that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of accounts from the accounting sums and balances list that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 | **Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637). **URI examples** **Retrieving of the accounting sums and balances list for account number 10000:**
.../accounting-sums-and-balances?filter=account_number eq 100000000 **Retrieving the first 10 accounts from the accounting sums and balances list:**
.../accounting-sums-and-balances?top=10 **Retrieving the next 10 accounts from the accounting sums and balances list:**
.../accounting-sums-and-balances?top=10&skip=10

get.summary: Retrieve a list of debitors
get.description:
Retrieve the debitors of a client/company. Debitors are the customers of a company. Together with the creditors, they constitute the business partners of a company. For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**Retrieving business partners with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a business partner object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the business partner object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Retrieving a delta of business partners, starting from a defined point in time** Using the filter "date_last_modification", synchronization scenarios can be achieved. By including the "date_last_modification ge 2017-01-01" filter in the URI, all business partners can be requested who have been modified since the date entered. The "date_last_modification" filter is entered in the format "date-time": YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD
Please note that the milliseconds are ignored during the request, whereas the time zone is relevant.

**Filter** If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - business_partner_number - caption - date_last_modification **Operators** *Filter option: account_number* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | | startswith | Starts with | | contains | Contains | *Filter option: caption* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | startswith | Starts with | | contains | Contains | *Filter option: business_partner_number* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | *Filter option: date_last_modification* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | ge | Greater than or equal | **Filter combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The business partners will be sorted by account number. For a consistent result, it is recommended that no new business partners be written during the retrieval process. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of business partners that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of business partners that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 | **Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving the debitor with the account number (account_number) 10000:**
.../debitors?filter=account_number eq 100000000 **Retrieving the debitors with account numbers ranging from 10000 to 29999:**
.../debitors?filter=account_number ge 100000000 and account_number le 299999999 **Retrieving debitors that have been modified since a stipulated point in time:**
.../debitors?filter=date_last_modification ge 2016-09-01T12:23:45 **Retrieving of the first 10 debitors:**
.../debitors?top=10 **Retrieving of the next 10 debitors:**
.../debitors?top=10&skip=10 **Retrieving of all debitors with the description beginning with 'Me':**
.../debitors?filter=startswith(caption,'Me')

200.description: A list of debitors has been retrieved.

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

post.summary: Create a new debitor with the next available account number
post.description:
A debitor is created using the next available account number. Please note: It is not possible to create debitors of an organization (marked with a "K"). Debitors are the customers of a company. Together with the creditors, they constitute the business partners of a company. It is not possible to create a business partner with an account number of your choice (account_number) using the POST command. The PUT command may be used to create a business partner with a specific account number (account_number, e.g. "100000000", technical length). For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**GoBD guidelines** Pursuant to guideline 1 of the principles regarding the proper keeping and retention of books, records, and documents in electronic form and regarding data access (GoBD), changes to the business partner master data (debitors and creditors) will be logged in Rechnungswesen. A log of all import activities can be retrieved within Rechnungswesen under: **Bestand | Importieren | Importprotokoll**.

**Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the business partner (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2016-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences. For example: JSON = 2016-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2016) | database = 2016-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2016)

See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

**Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

put.description:
A list of business partners can be updated/created using the desired account number (fill the property "id" with the desired account number, the property "account_number" must remain empty). A maximum of 500 business partners can be included in the list. **Important:** In order to create/update a list of business partners, the header "Content-Type: application/merge-patch+json" has to be submitted with the request. Please note: Debitors of a tax consultant (marked with a "K") are individualized for the client/company when they are updated (marked with a "I"). Debitors are the customers of a company. Together with the creditors, they constitute the business partners of a company. By transferring a list of business partners, only the business partners whose account number is specified are changed. This means that the existing list is not replaced by the transfer. Example: 1, 2, and 3 exist. 1 and 3 are transferred in a list. These are updated, the 2 remains unaffected. The information of the specified business partners is overwritten with the PUT command in its entirety, as known from an individual update. The PUT command may also be used to create a new business partner with a desired account number. For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**GoBD guidelines** Pursuant to guideline 1 of the principles regarding the proper keeping and retention of books, records, and documents in electronic form and regarding data access (GoBD), changes to the business partner master data (debitors and creditors) will be logged in Rechnungswesen. A log of all import activities can be retrieved within Rechnungswesen under: **Bestand | Importieren | Importprotokoll**.

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2016-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00

Together with the creditors, they constitute the business partners of a company. With the PUT command, the business partner will be completely overwritten. The PUT command may also be used to create a new business partner with a desired account number. **Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the business partner (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of creditors
get.description:
Retrieve the creditors of a client/company. Creditors are the suppliers of a company. Together with the debtiors, they constitute the business partners of a company. For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**Retrieving business partners with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a business partner object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the business partner object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Retrieving a delta of business partners, starting from a defined point in time** Using the filter "date_last_modification", synchronization scenarios can be achieved. By including the "ge date_last_modification" filter in the URI, all business partners can be requested who have been modified since the date entered. The "date_last_modification" filter is entered in the format "date-time": YYYY-MM-DDDhh:mm:ss.sTZD
Please note that the milliseconds are ignored during the request, whereas the time zone is relevant.

**Filter** If no further parameters are entered, the list contains its full scope.

**Filter options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - account_number - business_partner_number - caption - date_last_modification **Operators** *Filter option: account_number* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ge | Greater than or equal | | le | Less than or equal | | startswith | Starts with | | contains | Contains | *Filter option: caption* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | startswith | Starts with | | contains | Contains | *Filter option: business_partner_number* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | *Filter option: date_last_modification* | Operators | Description | |:----------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | ge | Greater than or equal | **Filter combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. The business partners will be sorted by account number. For a consistent result, it is recommended that no new business partners be written during the retrieval process. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of business partners that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of business partners that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 | **Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving the creditor with the account number (account_number) 70000:**
.../creditors?filter=account_number eq 700000000 **Retrieving the creditors with account numbers ranging from 70000 to 89999:**
.../creditors?filter=account_number ge 700000000 and account_number le 899999999 **Retrieving creditors that have been modified since a stipulated point in time:**
.../creditors?filter=date_last_modification ge 2016-09-01T12:23:45 **Retrieving of the first 10 creditors:**
.../creditors?top=10 **Retrieving of the next 10 creditors:**
.../creditors?top=10&skip=10 **Retrieving of all creditors with the description beginning with 'Me':**
.../creditors?filter=startswith(caption,'Me')

200.description: The list of creditors has been retrieved.

A maximum of 500 business partners can be included in the list. **Important:** In order to create/update a list of business partners, the header "Content-Type: application/merge-patch+json" has to be submitted with the request. Together with the debitors, they constitute the business partners of a company. By transferring a list of business partners, only the business partners whose account number is specified are changed. This means that the existing list is not replaced by the transfer. Example: 1, 2, and 3 exist. 1 and 3 are transferred in a list. These are updated, the 2 remains unaffected. The information of the specified business partners is overwritten with the PUT command in its entirety, as known from an individual update. post.summary: Transaction records for internal cost allocation in cost accounting.
post.description:
Transfer of transaction records for internal cost allocation in cost accounting. Certain services are performed in one cost center and allocated to one or more other cost centers or cost objects. The flow of services between these cost centers/carriers is included in the cost allocation report. They are recorded on a monthly basis. A maximum of 99,999 records can be created for a cost allocation month (maximum record number; if records already exist, only 99,999 minus the number of existing records can be imported).

get.description:

Cost accounting records are independent from financial accounting and are processed within cost. They are recorded monthly. The cost accounting records will be sorted by accounting record ID. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of cost accounting records that should be skipped. Example: skip=40 | | top | Number of cost accounting records that should be read as a result of the request.Example: top=20 | **Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. .../cost-accounting-records?top=10 **Retrieving of the next 10 cost accounting records:**

post.summary: Create a cost accounting record in a specific cost sequence
post.description:
Create a cost accounting record in a specific cost sequence.
The cost accounting record transferred is provided in the already exisiting cost sequence.

**Volume limit for accounting sequences** The maximum number of transaction records that can be written per accounting sequence depends on the infrastructure used by the client (e.g. hardware, network, etc.).

**Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the cost accounting record should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).
Example: 2016-12-30T00:00:00.000+01:00
If 23:59.59.999 is specified as the exact date and time, depending on the database field, the next day may be displayed due to rounding differences. For example: JSON = 2016-01-01T23:59:59.999+01:00 (01.01.2016) | database = 2016-01-02T00:00.000 +01.00 (02.01.2016)

See also the official site of Microsoft:
English article: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms187819.aspx
German article: https://technet.microsoft.com/de-de/library/ms187819.aspx

get.description:
The accounting statistics give you an overview of how many accounting records were posted each month.   
The number of prima nota entries (entered and imported records) and the number of journal entries (processed records) for each month are listed.   
Up to five journal entries can be generated from one prima nota entry (the entered record and the resulting tax entries, cash discount entries, Factor 2 entries, and so on).

get.summary: Retrieve a list of various addresses
get.description:
Retrieve the various addresses of a client/company. With various addresses, you can edit the addresses of various business partners. These are business partners that do not have their own account, but that are managed with other business partners under a single joint account number.

**Retrieving various addresses with subordinate objects** By including the parameter **expand=all** in the URI, the full scope of a various addresse object will be requested. In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the various address object will be requested without subordinate objects (bank, address, and communication details).

**Filter** Filters to condense the scope of the results are not available.

**Paging** When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. Please use top and skip for this purpose. Various addresses will be sorted by address number. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | skip | Number of various addresses that should be skipped. Example: skip=40| | top | Number of various addresses that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=20 | **Use multiple data paths** It is necessary to know the correct data path to address the correct data stock. If the correct data path cannot be determined in DATEVconnect, the desired data path can be defined by a configuration file to resolve this data path collision. Further information is provided in Info Database, document [1071637](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1071637).

**URI examples** **Retrieving of the first 10 various addresses:**
.../various-addresses?top=10 **Retrieving of the next 10 various addresses:**
.../various-addresses?top=10&skip=10

These are business partners that do not have their own account, but that are managed with other business partners under a single joint account number. For more information, please refer to the document Supplementary information for the interface documentation of DATEVconnect.

**GoBD finalization of accounting sequences** Pursuant to guideline 1 of the principles regarding the proper keeping and retention of books, records, and documents in electronic form and regarding data access (GoBD), changes to the business partner master data (various addresses) will be logged in Rechnungswesen. A log of all import activities can be retrieved within Rechnungswesen under: **Bestand | Importieren | Importprotokoll**.

**Date specification with time zone** The given time zone in the various address (for example, addresses and banks, temporary billing blocks) should correspond to the time zone set on the server, since otherwise dates may be deferred. As a rule, the given time zone is the Central European time zone (CET/CEST).

It is recommended that the time is set in this specific format 00:00:00.000 (hh:mm:ss.f).

id.description: Technical ID of the accounting transaction key

additional_function.description: (Zusatzfunktion) Indicates which tax calculation is applied in connection with the tax key (not specified, input tax, VAT)

cases_related_to_goods_and_services.description: (Sachverhaltsnummer) Number indicating the cases related to goods and services, see Info Database, document [1034915](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1034915). The value 0 is not allowed.

date_from.description: (Nutzungsbeginn) Start date of the applicable tax rate

date_to.description: (Nutzungsende) End date of the applicable tax rate

factor2_account1.description: (Faktor2 Konto 1) Factor2 Account 1 for individual tax keys

factor2_account2.description: (Faktor2 Konto 2) Factor2 Account 2 for individual tax keys

factor2_percent.description: (Faktor2 Prozent) Factor2 percent for individual tax keys

is_tax_rate_selectable.description: (Wählbarer Steuersatz) Selectable tax rate (if is_tax_rate_selectable = true, you have to specify a value for the tax rate (for example, 19%) when posting accounting sequences)

tax_rate.description: (Steuersatz) Tax rate applicable for the tax key

id.description: ID of a fiscal year, date of the first day in the fiscal year in the format YYYYMMDD

account_length.description: (Sachkontenlänge) General ledger account length, permissible general ledger account length of 4–8 digits, subledger accounts have general ledger account length + 1

advance_turnover_tax_return.description: (Voranmeldezeitraum) Advance turnover tax return (not specified, month, quarter, no advance turnover tax return).

basis_of_checking_account_function.description: (Grundlage der Kontenzweckprüfung) Basis of checking account function (only when there are no accounting reasons specified) (all purpose financial statement, tax balance sheet, balance of trade)

is_invoice_date_check_on.description: (Belegdatumsprüfung) Document date check **False** = entry of outgoing invoices with document date after a set date is permissible. **True** = entry of outgoing invoices with a document date after a set date is not permissible (invoice date check is active as a default setting within Rechnungswesen) This property supports you when writing accounting sequences/sets for outgoing invoices

is_locked.description: (Geschütztes Wirtschaftsjahr) Indicator of whether the fiscal year is protected from further processing

is_using_delivery_date.description: (Leistungsdatum nutzen) Use delivery date **False** = the setting "use delivery date"is not activated **True** = the setting "use delivery date" is activated This property supports you when writing accounting sequences/sets for outgoing and incoming invoices. For more information, see Info Database, document [9211426](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9211426).

is_using_receivable_type.description: (Forderungsarten nutzen) Use receivable type **False** = the setting "use receivable type" is not activated **True** = the setting "use receivable type" is activated This property supports you when writing accounting sequences/sets

legal_form.description: (Rechtsform) Legal form (not specified, sole proprietorship, corporation, cooperative, partnership under the german civil code, limited partnership with a limited liability company as general partner, limited partnership, general partnership, association, foundation, public corporation)

method_of_determining_net_income.description: (Gewinnermittlungsart) Method of determining net income (not specified, balance sheet, cash method of accounting)

national_right.description: (Nationales Recht) National law (DE = Germany and AT = Austria)

taxation_method.description: (Besteuerungsart) Taxation method (not specified, S = taxation based on value of services rendered, I = taxation based on value of actual receipts, Z = taxation based on value of actual receipts input tax deduction at payment (AT only), K = no vat calculation, P = lump sum)

id.description:
ID of the Open Item
  • Structure in the case of uncondensed items = first day of the fiscal year in which the accounting record was booked and the Open Item was created, plus a technical subkey, e.g. 20140101_3
  • Structure in the case of condensed items = business partner account number, a reference for the corresponding Open Item (usually the invoice number), and a temporary technical subkey, e.g. 10000_4711_R14

When data is supplemented/amended, the ID of the Open Item only changes in certain circumstances. Further information is provided in the Info Database, document [1001015](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1001015).

account_number.description: (Personen-Kontonummer) Subledger account shown in maximum length, 9 digits (technical length)

additional_information.description: (Zusatzinformationen) Additional information. A maximum of 10 additional information items are supplied per Open Item. Identical additional information items are only supplied once per Open Item. Sorted alphbetically.

balance_type.description: (Ausgleichsart) Balance type (balancing by means of payments or bank posting, manual clearing, zero balance run, return debit (public sector), subsequent division (public sector))

contra_account_number.description: (Gegenkontonummer) Contra account number, general ledger account shown at maximum length, 8 digits (technical length)

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben-Kennzeichen) Debit/credit identifier pertaining to the balance

document_field2.description: (Belegfeld 2) Document field 2, document number or Open Items processing information; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + -.

document_link.description: (Beleglink) Document link, identifies the entry document in a document management system

enforcement_date.description: (Vollstreckungsdatum) Enforcement date (only accounting clients with activated receivable types)

evidence_type.description: (Typ des Postens) Type of item (invoice, credit note, credit note by revocation, deposit, payment, cash discount)

is_cleared.description: (Ausgleichs-Kennzeichen) Clearing status, open or cleared item, false = open item, true = cleared item

open_balance_of_item.description: (Saldo) Balance of the Open Item still open

open_item_number.description: (Gruppierungsmerkmal) Group identifier for associated Open Items

payment_indicator.description: (Zahlungsträger) Identifier for payment media created and dunning level generated

payment_method.description: (Zahlweise) Payment method (not specified, direct debit, payment reminder, payment), Open Items information, public sector

receivables_type_id.description: (Forderungsart) Receivable type, Open Items information, public sector

tax_rate.description: (Steuersatz) Tax rate applicable to the Open Item

various_address_id.description: (Diversen Adresse) Assignment of a various address to this Open Item

dunning_level.description: (Mahnstufe) Dunning level applicable to an invoice

open_balance_of_item.description: (Offener Saldo des Offenen Postens) Balance of the Open Item still open

open_item_number.description: (Gruppierungsmerkmal) Group identifier for associated Open Items

payment_indicator.description: (Kennzeichen für erstellten Zahlungsträger und erstellte Mahnstufe) Identifier for payment media created and dunning level generated

payment_method.description: (Zahlweise) Payment method (not specified, direct debit, payment reminder, payment), Open Items information, public sector

receivables_type_id.description: (Forderungsart) Receivable type, Open Items information, public sector

tax_rate.description: (Steuersatz) Tax rate applicable to the Open Item

various_address_id.description: (Diversen Adresse) Assignment of a various address to this Open Item

id.description: ID, the ID is equal to the account number from the accounting sums and balances list

account_number.description: (Sach- oder Personen-Kontonummer) General ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length)

accounting_sums_and_balances_month_value.description: (Monatsverkehrzahlen) List of monthly debits and credits of the single fiscal year months

annual_value_debit.description: (Kumulierte Werte Soll) Annual value debit for the fiscal year

annual_value_credit.description: (Kumulierte Werte Haben) Annual value credit for the fiscal year

balance_debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben Kennzeichen Jahressaldo) Debit/credit identifier annual balance

opening_balance_sheet_debit_credit_ident.description: (Soll-/Haben Kennzeichen EB-Wert) Debit/credit identifier opening balance sheet

accounting_reason.description: (Rechnungslegungszweck) Accounting reason (independent from accounting reason, reserved 1, reserved 2, commercial law, tax law, international accounting standards, for calculation). On a POST, when no accounting reason is specified, the accounting reason defalts to independent_from_accounting_reason

application_information.description: (Anwendungsinformation) Application information, longer values will be truncated when using POST

description.description: (Bezeichnung des Buchungsstapels) Name of the accounting sequence, longer values will be truncated when using POST

initials.description: (Diktatkürzel) Command initials, longer values will be truncated when using POST

is_committed.description: (Festschreibekennzeichen) Finalization status flag, required functional field. Indicates if a sequence should be finalized during processing (TRUE = finalization, FALSE = no finalization). When the property "is_committed" is not transferred, the accounting sequence will be finalized automatically.

record_type.description: (Buchungstyp) Record type (financial accounting, annual financial statements)

accounting_records.description: (Buchungssätze) List of accounting records in the accounting sequence

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben Kennzeichen) Debit/credit identifier fot the monthly balance

accounting_transaction_key.description: (Steuerschlüssel und/oder Berichtigungsschlüssel) Tax key and/or adjustment key. For more information, please refer to the Info Database, documents [9231347](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9231347)

accounting_transaction_key49_additional_.description: (Steuerschlüssel und/oder Berichtigungsschlüssel) Tax key and/or adjustment key 49/89, additional function, used in agricultural circumstances

accounting_transaction_key49_main_functi.description: (Steuerschlüssel und/oder Berichtigungsschlüssel) Tax key and/or adjustment key 49/89, main function number, used in agricultural circumstances
(Steuerschlüssel und/oder Berichtigungsschlüssel) Tax key and/or adjustment key 49/89, main function type, used in agricultural circumstances

account_number.description: (Sach- oder Personen-Kontonummer) General ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length), required functional field

additional_functions_for_goods_and_servi.description: (Steuersatz/Funktion) Tax rate/function for the goods/services circumstance

additional_information.description: (Zusatzinformationen) Additional information that can be recorded with respect to accounting records; additional information always contains the following components; type and content of information; to use the additional information, both fields are mandatory

advance_payment.description: (Anzahlung) Advance payment, if this property is used, it is also important to fill the property "document_field1".

assessment_year.description: (Veranlagungsjahr) Assessment year, format YYYY, Open Items information, public sector

assigned_due_date.description: (Zugeordnete Fälligkeit) Assigned due date, Open Items information, public sector

business_partner_bank_position.description: (Geschäftspartnerbank) Business partner bank (numbering) if a specific business partner bank is to be used for a direct debit or bank transfer, only relevant for Open Items

bvv_position.description: Zuordnung einer Position für den Betriebsvermögensvergleich zu einem Buchungssatz, maximum length 1, 1 = Kapitalanpassung, 2 = Entnahme / Ausschüttung lfd. WJ, 3 = Einlage / Kapitalzuführung lfd. WJ, 4 = Übertragung § 6b Rücklage, 5 = Umbuchung (keine Zuordnung), document [9277189](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=9277189)

cases_related_to_goods_and_services.description: (Sachverhalt L+L) Cases related to goods/services, as per Sect. 13 b (1) sentence 1, items 1 to 5 UStG

cash_discount.description: (Skonto-Betrag/-Abzug) Cash discount amount/deduction, only permissible with payments

cash_discount_type.description: (Skontotyp) Cash discount type (not specified, purchase of goods, purchase of raw materials and supplies). If this property is transferred, the property "cash_discount" must also be transferred.

circumstance_type.description: (Sachverhalt) Circumstance type (0 = not specified, 31 = dunning interest, 40 = dunning fee, 84 = late payment charges) – the circumstance type is used by the DATEV accounting program to identify items as dunning interest/a dunning fee; for these items, no dunning interest will be calculated, for example, when drawing up payment reminders; only relevant for Open Items

contra_account_number.description: (Gegenkontonummer) Contra account number, general ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length)

currency_code.description: (Währung) 3-character ISO currency code – indicates the currency used for the amount, see Info Database, document [1080170](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080170)

date.description: (Belegdatum) Document date (the year will be ignored)

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben-Kennzeichen des Umsatzes) Debit/credit identifier for amount, pertains to the account that is specified in the account_number field

delivery_date.description: (Liefer-/Leistungsdatum) Date of delivery/service provision. The delivery date may not be later than the date in the field date. Additional information can be found here [https://www.datev.de/go/ratgeber-leistungsdatum](https://www.datev.de/go/ratgeber-leistungsdatum).

differing_taxation_method.description: (Abweichende Besteuerungsart) Differing taxation method; for entries that are to be processed using a VAT method other than the classification contained in the client master data (not specified, taxation based on value of services rendered, taxation based on value of actual receipts, taxation based on value of actual receipts input tax deduction at payment (AT only), no vat calculation, lump sum)

document_field1.description: (Rechnungs-/Belegnummer) Invoice/document number, document field 1 is the key for managing Open Items. In the event of a payment or credit note, a comparison with Open Items is only performed if the document number is identical to document field 1; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + - /

document_field2.description: (Belegfeld 2) Document field 2, document number or Open Items processing information; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + -.

document_link.description: (Beleglink) Document link, identifies the entry document in a document management system

document_system.description: (Dokumenten-Management-System) Document management system, program abbreviation for the document management system used, the property "document_system" must be transferred in conjunction with the property "document_link"

eu_tax_rate.description: (EU-Steuersatz Bestimmungsland) EU tax rate for country of destination, only for relevant EU accounting records. Additional for one Stop Shop, see Info Database [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_tax_rate_for_country_of_origin.description: (USt-IdNr Bestimmungsland) VAT ID number for country of destination, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) and additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_vat_id.description: (USt-IdNr Bestimmungsland) VAT ID number for country of destination, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) and additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

eu_vat_id_for_country_of_origin.description: (USt-IdNr Ursprungsland) VAT ID number for country of origin, composed of a 2-character country code and the 13-digit VAT number (e.g. FR12345678901), see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1080169) additional for one Stop Shop [1020263](https://apps.datev.de/help-center/documents/1020263)

exchange_rate.description: (Fremdwährungskurs) Exchange rate, used with accounting records in a foreign currency, stipulates how the amount stated and transferred in a foreign currency is to be translated into the base currency when a non-EU country is involved

has_cash_discount_block.description: (Skonto-Sperre) Cash discount block, only permissible in connection with outgoing invoices (accounting records related to debitors)

has_dunning_block.description: (Mahn-/Zahl-Sperre) Payment/dunning block, invoice can be excluded from reminders/payment proposal. Only relevant for an invoice entry and a subledger account (open item bookkeeping)

has_interest_block.description: (Zinssperre) Interest block, this field can be used to indicate an interest block; as a result, no interest will be calculated when creating a payment reminder for this item, only relevant for Open Item bookkeeping

kost1_cost_center_id.description: (Kost1) Kost1, cost center, Kost1 is used to assign the transaction to a cost center for subsequent cost calculations

kost2_cost_center_id.description: (Kost2) Kost2, cost center, Kost2 is used to assign the transaction to a cost center for subsequent cost calculations

kost_quantity.description:
(Kost-Menge) Cost quantity, the cost quantity field is used to record the value of a cost center's specific reference parameter, this reference parameter can be, for example, kg, g, cm, m or % and is defined in the cost calculation master data.
Attention: When using SKR 14 (agriculture and forestry), this field cannot be used. For this there are the fields quantity and weight.

payment_method.description: (Zahlweise) Payment method (not specified, direct debit, payment reminder, payment), Open Items information, public sector

quantity.description: (Stück) Quantity, can only be submitted when using SKR 14 agriculture and forestry

receivable_type_id.description: (Forderungsart) Receivable type, Open Items information, public sector

sepa_mandate_reference.description: (SEPA-Mandatsreferenz) SEPA mandate reference, an individual mandate identifier assigned by the payment recipient

various_address_id.description: (Diverse Adressnummer) Various address number, only relevant for Open Item bookkeeping

weight.description: (Gewicht) Weight, can only be submitted when using SKR 14 agriculture and forestry

additional_information_type.description: (Zusatzinformation-Art) Additional information type, an additional information always consists of an "additional_information_type" and an "additional_information_content"

additional_information_content.description: (Zusatzinformation-Inhalt) Additional information content, an additional information always consists of an "additional_information_type" and an "additional_information_content"

eu_member_state.description: (EU-Mitgliedstaat) EU member state of the subsequent final invoice, see Info Database, document [1080169](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080169). Except Greece: The country code is EL.

eu_tax_rate.description: (EU-Steuersatz) EU tax rate of the subsequent final invoice

record_type.description: (Buchungstyp) Record type (AA = requested advance payment/interim invoice, AG = received advance payment (cash receipt), SR = final invoice, SG = final invoice (cash receipt), SO = other)

revenue_account.description: (Erlöskonto) Revenue account of the subsequent final invoice, 8 digits (technical length)

tax_key.description: (USt-Schlüssel) VAT key of the subsequent final invoice

id.description: (Stapel-ID) Accounting sequence ID

accounting_reason.description: (Rechnungslegungszweck) Accounting reason (independent from accounting reason, reserved 1, reserved 2, commercial law, tax law, international accounting standards, for calculation)

inspection_status.description: (Prüfstatus) Inspection status (not specified = OK, record with error, record with warning)

record_type.description: (Buchungstyp) Record type (financial accounting, annual financial statements)

id.description: ID of the accounting record

account_number.description: (Sach- oder Personen-Kontonummer) General ledger or subledger account number shown in maximum length, 8 digits for general ledger accounts, 9 digits for subledger accounts (technical length)

additional_information.description: (Zusatzinformationen) Additional information. A maximum of 20 additional information is provided per accounting record. Identical additional information if provided only once per accounting record.

assessment_year.description: (Veranlagungsjahr) Assessment year, format YYYY, Open Items information, public sector

assigned_due_date.description: (Zugeordnete Fälligkeit) Assigned due date, Open Items information, public sector

business_partner_bank_position.description: (Geschäftspartnerbank) Business partner bank (numbering) if a specific business partner bank is to be used for a direct debit or bank transfer, only relevant for Open Items

cash_discount_type.description: (Skontotyp) Cash discount type (not specified, purchase of goods, purchase of raw materials and supplies)

circumstance_type.description: (Sachverhalt) Circumstance type (0 = not specified, 31 = dunning interest, 40 = dunning fee, 84 = late payment charges) – the circumstance type is used by the DATEV accounting program to identify items as dunning interest/a dunning fee; for these items, no dunning interest will be calculated, for example, when drawing up payment reminders; only relevant for Open Items

currency_code.description: (Währung) 3-character ISO currency code – indicates the currency used for the amount, see Info Database, document [1080170](https://apps.datev.de/knowledge/help/search?q=1080170)

debit_credit_identifier.description: (Soll-/Haben-Kennzeichen) Debit/credit identifier for amount, pertains to the account that is specified in the account_number field

differing_taxation_method.description: (Abweichende Besteuerungsart) Differing taxation method; for entries that are to be processed using a VAT method other than the classification contained in the client master data (not specified, taxation based on value of services rendered, taxation based on value of actual receipts, taxation based on value of actual receipts input tax deduction at payment (AT only), no vat calculation, lump sum)

document_field1.description: (Rechnungs-/Belegnummer) Invoice/document number, document field 1 is the key for managing Open Items. In the event of a payment or credit note, a comparison with Open Items is only performed if the document number is identical to document field 1

document_field2.description: (Belegfeld 2) Document field 2, document number or Open Items processing information; allowed characters: numbers 0 ... 9, uppercase letters A ... Z, lowercase letters a ... z, special characters $ & % * + -.

kost2_cost_center_id.description: (Kostenstelle) Kost2, cost center, Kost2 is used to assign the transaction to a cost center for subsequent cost calculations
